clinical_study.brief_title: Validity and Reliability of Perceived Exertion Rating Scale in Children With Brain Damage
clinical_study.official_title: Validity and Reliability of Perceived Exertion Rating Scale in Children With Traumatic Brain Injury, Cerebral Palsy and Typically Developed

oversight_info.authority: Israel: Israeli Health Ministry Pharmaceutical Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the reliability and validity of the rating of perceived exertion scale in children post severe traumatic brain injury during treadmill exercise.

detailed_description.textblock: walking on a treadmill twice- one weeks interval five intensity level in each session

primary_outcome.measure: OMNI scale, a pictorial perceived extortion scale for children

arm_group.description: Walking on treadmill, different velocities and incline

intervention.intervention_name: Walking on treadmill, different velocities and incline
intervention.description: Walking on treadmill twice, with one week interval in each session the child will walk in different velocities and incline

study_pop.textblock: Children post severe TBI Children with CP TD control
